bibl.title: The Papyrologist at Work. The J.H. Gray Lectures given at the University of Cambridge 1971.

series.title: Greek, Roman and Byzantine Monographs. No.

bibl.note: I. The Papyrologist at Work. - II. The Utilization of Small Fragments. - III. Village Administration in the Roman Empire in the Second Century. - Appendix. A New Copy of the Opening of Menander's Misoumenos.
bibl.seg: Turner Eric G., The Papyrologist at Work. The J.H. Gray Lectures given at the University of Cambridge 1971. (Greek, Roman and Byzantine Monographs. No. 6.)
Duke University, Durham, North Carolina, 1973, 8°, viii-52 pp. et 8 pll.

I. The Papyrologist at Work. - II. The Utilization of Small Fragments. - III. Village Administration in the Roman Empire in the Second Century. - Appendix. A New Copy of the Opening of Menander's Misoumenos.

C.R. par Alain Blanchard, REA (1974) pp. 411-412. - Bernard Boyaval, REG 88 (1975) pp. 344-345. - Hélène Cadell, RPhil 3e s., 49 (1975) pp. 138-139. - M. J. Costelloe, StPap 13 (1974) pp. 130-131. - James Frank Gilliam, CW 68 (1975) pp. 394-395. - Jean Lenaerts, ChrEg 51 (1976) No. 101, pp. 201-202. - Günther Poethke, ArchPF 24-25 (1976) pp. 171-172. - Deborah Samuel, BASP 12 (1975) pp. 129-131. - Richard Seider, Gnomon 48 (1976) pp. 166-170. - Livia Zingale Migliardi, Maia N.S., 27 (1975) pp. 74-75.
